page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY--THE GRANGE
page.content: {THE GRANGE NORTHINGTON}Only the exterior of this once magnificent mansion is on view to the public. The core was built in 1165/73 for Robert Henly by William Samwell (a follower of Inigo Jones). Then owned by Henry Drummond who let it to George IV. In 1809/16 it was externally transformed by William Wilkins into one of first Greek Revival Palladian buildings in Britain. In 1816 sold to Alexander Baring 1st Lord Ashburton. Further additions. In 1934 sold to Lewis Wallach & used by Army. In 1964 bought back by John Baring who intended to demolish and rebuild new house. Taken over by Department of the Environment in 1975 but in such bad condition by 1980 that not possible to restore interior. Exterior restored by 1983 and now open to public view.
